Definition:  Short-Term Recurring Income
Short-term recurring income
is recurring income that has not been counted on the VA award for at least 12 months.
An example of short-term recurring income is regular wages that are counted on the award for six months when the beneficiary is laid off and the income stops.
References
:  For more information on counting short-term recurring income as nonrecurring income for income calculation purposes, see
38 CFR 3.271(a)(1) and (3)
, and
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.E.6.p
.
